info.title: DESCRIPTION
info.body: BOYSEN®® Permatex™ is a water-based, full-bodied paint that dries to a fine, rubbery coating that does not become brittle over time. It creates a beautiful textured finish on interior walls and ceilings that brings elegance to your home's interior. It adheres easily on wood, concrete, or fiberboard surfaces. It is also able to conceal hairline cracks and minor surface imperfections.

info.title: PRINCIPAL USES
info.body: It is ideal for interior surfaces like concrete, drywall, and properly primed wood. Avoid using product on high friction areas.

info.title: SERVICE CONDITIONS
info.body: Different textured effects may be achieved by using a variety of design rollers.

info.title: MATERIAL PREPARATION
info.body: For a regular texture pattern, apply BOYSEN®® Permatex™ straight from the can using a textured roller. If a different design pattern is desired, first apply BOYSEN®® Permatex™ using a textured roller. While paint is still wet and workable, press desired design pattern roller over wet paint and roll in one direction to impress the design onto the surface.

info.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
info.subtitle: New Concrete
info.body: Allow new concrete to dry for 14-28 days under normal weather conditions before painting. Surface to be painted should be clean and dry, free from oil, grease, dust, dirt, contaminants, and all loose grit and mortar. If neutralizing, treat surface with a solution of 1 part BOYSEN®® Masonry Neutralizer B‑44 diluted in 16 parts water, applying liberally by brush or roller. Let dry overnight before rinsing with water to remove white crystals that form on the surface. Let dry before painting. However, if the concrete has been cured for more than 28 days, there is no need for neutralizer.

info.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
info.subtitle: Wooden Surfaces
info.body: Surface to be painted should be clean and dry, free from dust, dirt, and other foreign matter. Hammer all nails deep enough to apply putty. Sand rough wood until smooth and then dust off before painting. Avoid using product on high friction areas.

info.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
info.subtitle: Drywall Substrates
info.body: Install and secure joints as per manufacturer's recommendations.

info.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
info.subtitle: Repainting
info.body: Scrape off all loose, scaling, flaking, and peeling paint manually or by using BOYSEN®® Paint and Varnish Remover B‑141, as necessary. Wash surfaces clean and completely remove chemical residue. Let it dry. For repainting concrete with chalky old paint, use BOYSEN®® Chalk Blocker™ B‑7304 as surface conditioner. In case of mildew infestation, treat with a bleach solution (1:3, laundry bleach to water, respectively) by swabbing or brushing. To ensure proper treatment, let stand for 24 hours before cleaning off residue. Let dry. For repainting other surfaces such as wood, apply the appropriate primer before recoating.

info.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
info.subtitle: Concrete Surfaces
info.body: Primer: BOYSEN®® Permacoat™ Flat Latex B‑701 Putty: BOYSEN®® Masonry Putty B‑7311 Texture: BOYSEN®® Permatex™ B‑3101 2nd & 3rd coat: BOYSEN®® Permacoat™ Latex (any desired color) (optional)

info.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
info.subtitle: Wooden Surfaces
info.body: Primer: BOYSEN®® Flatwall Enamel B‑800 Putty: BOYSEN®® Plasolux Glazing Putty B‑311 Texture: BOYSEN®® Permatex™ B‑3101 2nd & 3rd coat: BOYSEN®® Permacoat™ Latex (any desired color) (optional)
